> On March 19, 2016 at 9:33 AM, Scotius said:
> 
> 
> This game requires...and rewards patience and long-term planning. Players who come here for explosions and cheap thrills of slamming planes and missiles into buildings, tend to leave sooner rather than later. I imagine someone with mental fortitude to painstakingly grind science and money to completely explore the system will be able to forgive much ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")
> 

While I don't fundamentally disagree, I find it funny since the game (unmodded) provides us with no long-term planning, heck no short-term planning tools whatsoever.

It would be awesome to see not just the always requested dv/twr data available in stock, but the ability to "doodle" with maneuver nodes as a form of mission planning so we could then design a craft that hits the dv requirements for each of the burns required.

S!  Shot Down by a Hurricane was one of the first WillyTee cartoons I saw (and still my favorite)! I never got into a vid (or comic) myself, but one of my squaddies did (Squidrd). But yeah, I'm with you I haven't seen much in the way of 'hate' here. In WWIIOL I stayed off the forums! ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif ":P")

There's generally too much hyperbole on teh interwebs.

It is a good thing that a game company actually keeps developing it's game. Fixing bugs, upgrading engines, increasing performance and so on.

It is a bad thing that a game company breaks backward compatibility with savegames and/or mods.

Overall I'd say these 2, even if cancelling eachother out somewhat, still equals to a good thing... but the combination will receive critique and negativity and I think it's silly not to expect it.

Or in other words... That while game suddenly runs x percent faster is awesome, it does not instantly make the rage over a x hours of gametime investment turned invalid good... That will take a bit of time...

Hopefully once KSP really is finished... It will be the better for it...

Not breaking mods is practically impossible.

However, 1.1 *should* be able to automagically update saves as old as 0.25 or something. Even if they're modded saves it should/might work if you have the proper mods installed. 

**Edited <time datetime="2016-04-08T18:39:33Z" title="04/08/2016 06:39  PM" data-short="8 yr">April 8, 2016</time> by KerbonautInTraining**

It is no different than any other platform out there.  Ever.  You're going to have the people that are never completely happy, and you're going to have the people that sit poised at their keyboards ready to leap to the developers defense when someone asks a question of them.  Somewhere in the middle are the rest who just kind of go from day to day with the game, play it, hate it, play it some more, then find something wrong, then find something great, then read the forums, then say hi, then go over there....etc.

Personally, I think I spent like 10 bucks on the damn thing years ago.  I've certainly gotten my 10 or whatever bucks out of it since then.  That said though....I do think there are some real concerns for people that have forked out over 30 bucks for a game that never really was, or will be 'done'.  Yeah, I think that there are some legitimate concerns there and Squad should continue to address them.  They sold it, they got the moola for it, and if they intend to stick around with it, then they should fix it up.  Ethically speaking.  They're free to do whatever they wish though.  I don't miss my 10 bucks anymore.  ![^_^](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_happy.png "^_^")
This evening I went to my local pub and spent more than I paid for KSP and I didn`t even get drunk.

As I said... it's a good thing that the game is still getting improved and expanded, but that automatically entails the abovementioned negativity. It shouldn't come as a surprise...

2. That has mostly been my experience as well... but it has made it impossible to update or maybe even continue games for some. I'd be somewhat negative over that too... even if it made for a better game in the end.

...

Possibly some truth to the critique of version 1.0 having been called too soon... Had ksp still had the beta description... I think people would have been more lenient.

Whether something is "done"/finished... is a binary answer to me atleast... it's either yes or no... it's not a "mostly" ... ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)") ... Atleast that's my mental approach to things like that...
